review: You look through all these specs and you think, "Well yeah, this is the best choice?" Right? That's what I thought.Here's the deal: the stick is slick as hell, it plugs right in and runs automatically with seemingly little problems until you get the first buffering signal and you think, "What's the deal? My wifi's working fine."Then by the 10,000th time of a complete inability to find the wifi signal, it's bloody unforgivable. There is no reason why the stick might be unable to find the signal since the times it can, the signal strength is, "Very Strong." It's not too far away from the router and all my other wireless devices have 5 bars of signal from where the TV sits. This problem is not unique to me: http://www.amazon.com/forum/kindle?_encoding=UTF8&cdForum;=Fx1D7SY3BVSESG&cdThread;=Tx3NZOXPD7O278JIt's clearly a problem with the stick itself and because of it, I'm going to try my luck with one of the other options with "lesser" specs.
